fields.summary: Links with URLs containing certain non-alphanumeric characters fail to save

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45789].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Links with URLs containing certain non-alphanumeric characters fail to save 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click open any issue
# Click on *More* and then *Link*
# Select *Web Link*
Example:  
{code}
http://company/projects/Shared%20Documents/Forms/AllItems.aspx?RootFolder=%2Fprojectweb%2FShared%20Documents%2FFF%20ER&FolderCTID=0E128&View= {A6-4B6B-44A79F36}
{code}
# Put a link with non-alphanumeric characters
# Save it by clicking on *Link*

h3. Expected Results
The Link should be saved and viewable on the issue like any other web link.

h3. Actual Results
Doesn't save. We get the following error on the UI
{noformat}
Invalid 'URL'. Make sure you include the full URL (e.g. http://www.google.com).
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
# Go to Google Shortner at https://goo.gl/
# Paste the URL
# Google will generate a *short url* for your URL which you will be able to link in JIRA.
# Google will also be change your *long URL* to characters, which can also be saved onto JIRA
fields.summary: Links with URLs containing certain non-alphanumeric characters fail to save
Allow screens to be restricted by user group

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Radio button custom field disappears on clicking in new issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable new issue view > Create some custom fields of radio button type > Add it to the screen 
# On the view screen click on the radio button fields on the right-hand panel to edit it. Instead of the field getting edited the field completely disappears but re-appears on releading the page
(refer attachment)

h3. Expected Results
The field should not disappear from the view screen in new issue view. Instead, it should be editable.

h3. Actual Results
The field disappears from the view screen in new issue view. Instead, it should be editable.

h3.Workaround
Switch to the old issue view.
fields.summary: Radio button custom field disappears on clicking in new issue view

fields.description:
The default language setting for a new user / new instance is browser detection. 

On the user preferences screen, a new user has a drop-down list containing languages. The initial value is "Pick your language". Once a user chooses this, however, they lose the option of going back to browser-based detection - only one of the other languages can be chosen.

In the past we had the option to choose "browser based detection" in the list of languages, however this seems to have been removed.

I suggest we eitehr add this back to the list or provide another way to choose browser based language selection.
fields.summary: Choosing a language in user prerfences removes the option of browser-based language selection

fields.description:
Sometimes I want to manage my stories and issues by new-gen Jira Roadmap with Epic together. Could you able to display them on the roadmap?

 

Thank you.
fields.summary: Display the Stories and Issues of the Epic on Roadmap

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the New Jira Issue View, while viewing a sub-task in dialog mode, when a user tries to add an Epic Link, the warning message stating that it is not possible to assign a sub-task to an Epic is hidden.

 !Epic link sub-task.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Open a sub-task that has the "Epic Link" field mapped to its screen;
* Try to assign this sub-task to an Epic.

h3. Expected Results
* The user is able to view the warning message.

h3. Actual Results
* The warning message is hidden.

 !Hidden warning.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Workaround(s)
* At this moment, there is none.
fields.summary: When viewing a sub-task in dialog mode, the warn message is hidden when trying to set an Epic Link

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As a Jira administrator, I have added a list of available sub-tasks on my cloud site (screenshot from my test cloud site with random names):
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

As a Jira administrator, I want to have the option to select the default default Sub-Task issue type value based on the parent Issue Type. So, for example, for issue type *Bug* I want the default *Sub-Task issue type value* set as *Sub-Bug*. 

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Why this is important
Avoid user-related errors by forgetting to set the correct sub-task value.  


h3. Workaround 
Currently, there is no workaround to set the default value for sub-tasks. So, raising user awareness to not forget selecting the sub-task value is the only valid way.
fields.summary: Set default Sub-Task based on parent Issue Type

fields.description:
The vertical sidebar on the left has been recently changed and now collapsing it does not integrate it with the leftmost bar, but leaves a tiny bit of it present.

Also, the navigation bar expands to full size when hovering the mouse over it.

We would like to have the old sidebar back that can be completely collapsed
fields.summary: bring back the old side bar collapsing

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, there is no field dependancy in Jira. The closest we have is the "Select List (cascading)" custom field, although it is a simple solution that add only multi level optioning.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability for admins to make a field required based on the value of other field.

h3. Why this is important
This should enhance Jira's customization capabilities.

h3. Workaround 
There is none.
fields.summary: As an admin, when transitioning issues, I'd like to make a field required based on the value of other field

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

 As of now, you are only able to view the "Date" value in the "Created/Updated" filter

 !1.PNG|thumbnail! 


In order to view the time as well, you will need to hover on the "Created/Updated" column in the filter in order to get the time value. 

 !hover.png|thumbnail! 


h3. *Suggested Solution*
 
Allow the configuration of allowing time to be viewed at a glance without the need to hover. 

h3. *Why this is important*

This helps the user to get a better view of the issue and grasp the period of when the issue has been created/updated.
fields.summary: The ability to have Date & Time appear in the filter column together

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Attempting to _move_ an issue (task, story etc) that has sub-tasks from one project to another cannot be done as at the final step the user is given an error:
{quote}
At least one of the issues you are trying to move has been recently updated by another user (<issue key>). Please cancel and start again.
{quote}

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create one issue with one or more sub-tasks
# Attempt to move that issue to another project
# Map the destination status to reach the final step
# Once the user clicks *confirm* at the final step, the error is thrown: At least one of the issues you are trying to move has been recently updated by another user (TS3-2). Please cancel and start again.
# Of course, trying again yelds the same result.

h3. Expected Results
The issue is moved together with its sub-tasks

h3. Actual Results
An error message is thrown:
{quote}At least one of the issues you are trying to move has been recently updated by another user (TS3-2). Please cancel and start again.
 {quote}

h3. Workaround
One workaround would be to create a task in the destination project and move only the sub-tasks. However, this is not practical for situations when the user needs to move multiple tasks together with their sub-tasks
fields.summary: Moving a Jira task with sub-tasks to another project throws an error

fields.description:
Currently, if a user tries to update the profile settings, the default language selection drop -down is set to *pick a language*.  Even if the user has to change any other setting and does not select a language, an error is shown which is not helpful and does not point to the actual problem.

 !Screenshot from 2019-01-10 15-34-47.png|thumbnail! 

The suggestion is to update the error message to point to the correct problem and even better if a profile language is already set, then it should auto reflect in the language drop-down.
fields.summary: Improve the error message when updating profile

fields.description: When viewing boards in the iOS app, the card layout that I have configured for a board isn't honored.
fields.summary: Support board card layout customization in Jira Cloud mobile app
Test

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When trying to create a new Jira issue directly from gmail using the app *Atlassian Cloud for Gmail*, a list of projects is provided (in which the jira issue will be added), this list does not include all projects but it is based on the recently viewed projects list: More specifically, it picks up to 10 recently viewed projects from each of the instances the user is logged in.

 !0001.jpg|thumbnail! 

 !0002.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the user to customize the list of projects that will show up? 
* The number of projects. 
* Which projects will show up. 
* Which instance. 

h3. Why this is important
 * Less time consuming and easier to work with. 

h3. Workaround 
* Currently there is no workaround to customize this.
fields.summary: Customize which projects show in the Atlassian Cloud for Gmail

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the new issue view, the custom field type 'Date Time Picker' allows the user to select a time range from a dropdown starting from 9 AM to 6 PM with every 30 minutes interval. This creates confusion amongst the users whether or not they can set a custom time inside/outside this range.

!Current dropdown.png|width=177,height=121!
h3. Suggested Solution

Setting a custom time is possible by simply clicking the time field and manually typing the time. To avoid any confusion, we can prompt the user with a message like "Enter Time here" when the time picker field is clicked/hovered.

!Typing manually.png|width=171,height=102!
h3. Why this is important

The functionality to set custom time works perfectly fine but also creates unnecessary confusion as the time picker only shows specific time range in the drop-down.
fields.summary: Date Time Picker only shows time range between 9 AM - 6 PM

fields.description:
Now when you want to create a xml-backup for server you must first migrate all projects to regular Jira projects.  Jira can't create a backup for server at all, if there's any next-gen projects, even if they are completely empty. 

There should be an option for you to simply skip (not backing up) the next-gen projects. This would be especially useful when you want to migrate parts of your Jira Cloud instance to server.
fields.summary: Possibility to skip next-gen projects when creating xml-backup for server

fields.description:
h3. Description
 * For system fields such as Fix Version(s), it is possible to create new Versions if one already exists. Version picker custom fields, however, only allow users to select existing fields, but not create new ones.

h3. Suggestion
 * This type of field could allow users to create new versions from it. This would create some sort of consistency between system and custom fields that handle versions.
fields.summary: Version Picker fields should allow the creation of new Versions

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

All the Jira pages need to be secured with a Login Page.

h3. Steps to reproduce the issue

Landing pages like dashboard, projects etc are accessible for the users which out authentication.

https://(jiraURL)/secure/Dashboard.jspa

Though no data is visible, it is recommended we have a Login page pop up when accessing any Jira cloud link.
fields.summary: All the Jira pages need to be secured with a Login Page.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Navigating the Jira issue via keyboard Does not work as expected.

Only the editable or the clickable fields are highlighted and read. And the other fields are not.

Affects both new issue view and old issue view.

h3. Steps to reproduce the issue

Open a Jira issue

Navigate the issue with a tab or up/down arrow.

We can observe that the it only selects the clickable fields on the screen.

Not all the fields are selected.

h3. Actual result

Nope editable fields are not highlighted

h3. Expected result

All the fields should be read and highlighted

h3. Workaround

No workaround yet
h3. Why this is important 

This affects users using the NVDA Application. NVDA is the application helps the visually impaired users access technology.

The NVDA application reads the values that are highlighted via mouse pointer or Keyboard navigation.

Since the users use Keyboard navigation, they are missing on reading most of the values and data in the ticket.
fields.summary: Navigating the Jira issue via keyboard Does not work as expected.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the current Cloud release, project key only allow (A-Z & 0-9) with no special characters e.g '-' 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow project key to have character e.g _FIN-MA_ instead of FINMA

h3. Why this is important
Allowing the use of other punctuation, like a dash or period, would make
things easier to read; e.g.:

- FIN-JK 
- FIN-REW
- DD-OOP
fields.summary: Project key should allow to have character e.g '-'

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If in the Server instance there's an external directory managing the users besides the Jira internal, the users will not be imported. Only the users in Jira internal directory.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Jira Server instance and integrate any External directory to manage the users, e.g. Crowd, AD
# Add users to this external directory and they will be properly created in Jira and they're associated with this external directory.
# Generate a backup of this Server instance and import into Cloud.

h3. Expected Results
The users from both the internal and external directories would be imported into Cloud.

h3. Actual Results
Only the users from the internal directory are imported.
The external directory is actually imported to Cloud's database, although as inactive, for example:
||id||directory_name||active||
|1 |JIRA Internal Directory |0 |
|2 |Remote Crowd Directory |0 |
|10100 |IDP Directory |1 |
And the users are also imported to the database, however, they're all pointing to the external directory as they were in Server, and the users pointing to the external directory don't cause any effect to the instance as they do not even show up in the UI. It's most likely as they don't exist in the application.

h3. Workaround
Migrate the users from the external directory to the internal directory in the Server instance prior to migrating.
fields.summary: It would be great if users managed by an external directory in Jira would be imported during site import

fields.description:
With the new issue view, we lost the ability to update the Epic Name.
Now, with the new Issue Layout, we are able to edit the order of the fields, but we don't have the Epic Name field available to add to the Epic view so we can update it.

It would be great if the Epic Name field is available on the new Issue Layout panel on Project Settings so we can update the Epic Name from the Epic view.
fields.summary: Missing Epic Name field on new Issue Layout settings

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a validator *Field has been modified Validator* is set on a transition for a "Text Field (multi-line)" field, the transition goes through even if it's not being modified during the transition.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a custom field with type *Text Field (multi-line)*
 # Add *Field has been modified Validator* validator (with an error message) to a transition to check if the field's value is being updated during transition
 # Add a screen, that contains the field
 # Create an issue and add a value to the custom field in edit/view issue screen
 # Transition the issue using the transition in which the validator is set. Do not update/modify the field's value during transition

h3. Expected Result

Issue could not be transitioned as the field's value is not being modified during the transition
h3. Actual Result

The transition goes through even if the field's value is not updated
h3. Note

If the field is empty and it has never a value the validator works fine and the validator error message appears during the transition. But if the field has a value, or it has value previously and is empty now, the validator does not work.
h3. Workaround

Use the *Value Field* condition: "The field <Field Name> will have to be not equal to value 'NULL'. Compared as String."
 _(change the Field as per your site)_
 !Screenshot 2020-07-13 at 14.48.42.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: "Field has been modified Validator" does not work for Text Field (multi-line)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
opsbar-sequence property doesn't sequence transitions in corrent order in new issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to product access > Click on any one of the system users (Slack, Sketch etc)
# It redirects to "Users" 
# Clicking on normal users opens the details which contain products access' and groups the user is associated with

h3. Expected Results
The details page should open as on ADG2 showing the products the system users have access to. 

h3. Actual Results
Clicking on any one of the system users (Slack, Sketch etc) under product access redirects to "Users" 

h3.Workaround
No Workaround.
fields.summary: System users under product access redirects to Users in ADG3

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

It is not possible to clone an issue if there is a post function to clear the value of the *Sprint* field, and the post function is positioned before the *Creates the issue originally* post function in the *Create* transition:
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-09 at 11.40.17.png|thumbnail! 

When trying to clone, there will be an error message:
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-09 at 11.38.11.png|thumbnail! 

{noformat}
Can't clone this issue. com.atlassian.jira.workflow.WorkflowException: Unable to clear field - customfield_10021 - Sprint
{noformat}

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a *Clear field value* post function in the *Create* transition;
# Position that post function before the *Creates the issue originally* -> *Publish the workflow*;
# Try to clone an issue associated to that workflow.

h3. Expected Results

The issue will be cloned.

h3. Actual Results

The issue won't be cloned, and an error message like . the following will be displayed:
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-09 at 11.38.11.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

Position the *Clear field value* post function after the *Creates the issue originally* post function, or remove it from the transition:
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-09 at 11.49.29.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Issue cannot be cloned if there is a post function to clear the value of the Sprint field in the Create transition

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the Chrome add-on _Zephyr Capture for Jira_, the images that it saves as an attachment to a Jira issue cannot be previewed from the board view.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Using the Chrome add-on _Zephyr Capture for Jira_, take a screenshot and have it attached to a Jira issue.
* Navigate to a Jira board, either to the backlog view or the actual board view and click on the issue that has the attachment
* In the issue preview (right-hand side) locate the attachment and click on it to preview it

h3. Expected Results
The preview will work and the image would be shown in the preview modal

h3. Actual Results
The preview does not work and the user is prompted to download the image
 
h3. Notes
# If the user manually downloads the image and then re-uploads it, the preview works
# The preview from the board works in the old issue view
# Upon further investigation, it looks like the *mimetype* parameter of the attached image file is *image/x-png*. Downloading the image and then re-uploading it creates a new attachment with *mimetype*=*image/png*. With this parameter, the preview works just fine.

h3. Workaround
# Use the old view
# Navigate to the issue itself by clicking the issue key. This will open the issue in a new browser tab where the preview works
fields.summary: Pictures saved from Capture for Jira Cloud cannot be previewed from the board view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Option to disable notifications bell icon

h3. Suggested Solution
The customers should have the option to enable/disable the notifications icon on their Cloud Instance

h3. Why this is important
 Some customers find it distracting as they already receive all of the notifications over an email. It seems to lower down their productivity at work.
fields.summary: Option to disable the notifications

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When attaching a PNG image using *Capture for Jira*, the image cannot be previewed from the issue.

h3. Environment
* Jira New Experience
* Capture for Jira

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install *Capture for Jira*
# Take a screenshot and attach the image using "Capture for Jira" and attach it to an issue
# Check the attachment from Jira issue

h3. Expected Results
The attachment is showing when we preview it.

h3. Actual Results
It shows "Ouch! We can't preview this file type."
 !screenshot.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
* Previewing the attachment from old issue view is working fine
* The preview is working when:
** Attach and upload a JPG file using "Capture for Jira"
** Drag-and-drop a PNG file from local machine to the issue

h3.Workaround
* View the issue in the old Jira view, eg: 
{code}https://example.atlassian.net/browse/<issue-key>?oldIssueView=true{code}
fields.summary: Jira New Experience Didn't Handle PNG Image From Add-ons
Side nav fails to load with 429

fields.description:

fields.description:
There are a number of fields we do not use on our Jira tickets, so to avoid this visual noise, I worked with a Jira Admin to remove the fields. We are now left with an awkward blank gap on our Jira issues. I notice another person raised a ticket regarding this same issue: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33430

 

Is it possible to allow for fields to be reordered on a ticket, or another design solution to address this? Thanks!
fields.summary: Allow for customization in ordering of fields on tickets

fields.description:

h3. Problem Definition
Customer not able to modify/hide options like search, projects & dashboard on the nav bar for specific users/groups.

Ability to modify/hide options like search, projects & dashboard on the nav bar for specific users/groups.

fields.summary: Ability to modify/hide options on the nav bar

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a Next-gen project is created with the same issue type as the existing classic projects, some fields cannot be used in the Basic search



h3. Steps to Reproduce

_*Scenario 1*_ :

If you have a Classic Project and a Next-gen project, after configuring the default configuration scheme for a Custom Field with context defined for any issue type present in the next-gen project, when performing a *basic* search filtering for that *Custom Field*, the following message is returned: "Field is not applicable to the current project and/or issue type".

We created a video reproducing this problem as you can see here: [^JRACLOUD-71320.mp4]
This video shows that the search works before creating the next-gen project, but it doesn't after creating it.

# Create a Classic project
# Create a Next-gen project
# Go to Administration > Issues > Custom fields
# Navigate to that Custom field, then go to Cog Icon > Configure
# Edit the Applicable contexts for scheme with any issue type present in the next-gen project.
# Try searching for issues using that Custom Field and some type that exists in next-gen projects on Basic Search

_*Scenario 2 : System Fields*_

 # Create a classic Scrum project. Make sure that Story issue type is used by the project. 
 # Create a Sprint and assign some issues. 
 # Perform a basic search on the Classic Project, Story Issue type and Sprint. (Works OK)
 # Create a Next-Gen scrum project. Make sure Story issue type is used by the project.
 # Try to perform a basic search again on the Classic Project, Story Issue type and Sprint

_*Scenario 3 : Custom Fields*_

 # Create a classic project. Make sure that Story issue type is used by the project. 
 # Create a Custom field and assign to the screens of the classic project
 # Perform a basic search on the Classic Project, Story Issue type and Custom_Field. (Works OK)
 # Create a Next-Gen scrum project. Make sure Story issue type is used by the project.
 # Try to perform a basic search again on the Classic Project, Story Issue type and Custom_Field


h3. Expected Results

You are able to select the Field on the Basic Search.

 !sprint.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

A warning is shown on the UI: "Field is not applicable for the current project and/or issue type".

 !error.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

This seems to happen because Jira is mistaken the global issue type with the next-gen issue type.

h3.Workaround

- Using Global context on the Custom Field configuration makes the behavior not reproducible anymore.
- Use the Advanced search and JQL should still work.
fields.summary: Fields cannot be queried via Basic search

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Export to csv uses both a carriage return and a linefeed for multiline data

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Search for issues (which have multi-line data in some fields, like Description for example) in Issue Navigator
# Export to CSV (all fields)

h3. Expected Results
Data is exported to CSV and can be viewed correctly in Excel.

h3. Actual Results
Data is exported to CSV but does not render correctly in Excel for iOS.

h3. Workaround
Export to CSV only the with the Current Fields and not selecting a multi-line field)
fields.summary: Export to CSV formatting multiline text

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Manually typing <instance-domain.atlassian.net/projects/project-Key> causes an infinite loop instead of redirecting to a correct URL.
h3. Suggested Solution
Redirect the navigation to an accessible URL
h3. Why this is important
To avoid users to think that there is something wrong with Jira where actually the inserted URL in incorrect.
fields.summary: Better handling for manually typed URL

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating an JQL to export issues via CSV, if the result has only issues with empty value on *Select List* field or *Component* field, the CSV file will not create the columns for the these fields with empty values. 

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JQL that returns only issues with a *Select List* field or *Component* field with empty values (on all issues)
# Try to export the issues via CSV

h3. Expected Results
The columns for these fields with empty values should be created in CSV file.

h3. Actual Results
These fields columns are not created.

h3.Workaround
Set a default value for these fields so they can be created on the CSV file
fields.summary: For CSV export , Component/s field or Select List fields with empty values will not be created on the CSV export

fields.description: how setup alarm or notification inside Jira panel. i shar this topic in  [bistka|https://bistka.com/].
fields.summary: alarm in jira

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When a user adds a comment from mobile, we can see the bottom of the added message the following:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

This provides a link to Jira mobile apps in every comment on any ticket.

For some companies, not all users are allowed to use mobile apps, so providing a feature to disable showing the message on the bottom will ensure to not have a random link showing up in comments.

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a global settings to disable adding the message stated above to each comment.

h3. Why this is important

Administrators for security reasons need to control the data added on the platform.
* Example: ensure that the BYOD rule is respected. 

h3. Workaround

Unfortunately, currently there is no automated workaround. So, removing the message on the bottom manually is the only available way.
fields.summary: Provide a settings to split messages added from mobile

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The sidebar in the moment of creation an Issue Collector is not loading properly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Access a project;
# Go to its project settings;
# Select the option "Issue Collectors";
# Click to add an issue collector.

h3. Expected Results
The Issue Collectors page will be loaded correctly.

h3. Actual Results
The Issue Collectors page is not loaded completely.
 !Sidebar.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: When Creating an Issue Collector the Page doesn't load Correctly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When accessing the projects from Cloud Home page, it keeps refreshing for some instances

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Jira and access any project, so they are showing under "Recent projects"
# Access Cloud Homepage: https://example.atlassian.net/home/notifications
# Access the project from the sidebar

h3. Expected Results
Project is loaded

h3. Actual Results
The page keeps refreshing and the project is not accessible.

*Application logs:*

fields.description:
As is noted here:

[https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/#api-api-3-issue-issueIdOrKey-changelog-get]

When you are retrieving a list of change logs for an issue, the 'items' field has 'from' and 'to' fields that can be used to track changes to custom fields. Currently these return fields are in the form of strings of usernames, not account ID's. It is my understanding these will be removed soon, and with no alternative it will be impossible to track changes to custom fields.

Are there any plans to change this so that account ID's are returned, to allow for changes to be tracked?

Thank you.
fields.summary: /api/3/issue/{issueIdOrKey}/changelog does not return accountId in list of items

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update on June 11th}
Hi everyone, thanks again for the interest on this ticket. We’re marking this ticket as closed now because a workaround has been released to solve the issue of "users always being forced into the American format of mm/dd/yyyy" by allowing each user to format their dates and times on the new issue view based on their language preferences. For many of you, this workaround solved the problem.

 

*Cross-post May 24th update on workaround*
 * Users can now change the *{color:#00875a}default edit and display of both date and date/time fields{color}*,{color:#00875a} *using their language/locale setup (i.e. "en_AUS" or "Dutch")*{color} instead of being forced into the American month/day/year display only. Here’s how to setup yours: [https://support.atlassian.com/atlassian-account/docs/manage-your-language-preferences/].
 * For those using language not supported (i.e. Greek). We suggest you choose UK English as your preference to get the desired display of day/month/year.

For those customers that still face challenges with this solution we have opened a new ticket where we will gather interest specifically on when the user level language based settings is not a viable solution. Please comment on this new ticket https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-76814 to let us know your specific use case (i.e. why it’s important to have a specific date/time settings, and whether you’d like it at admin or user level), so we can ensure the experience we release works for you.

For those concerned about their calendar locking Sunday as the first day of the week, watch and comment on this ticket: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-71611 

 *Appendix: Details on what to expect to be displayed when you setup your language*

The Atlassian Product Team
{panel}
h3.  
{panel:title=Atlassian Update on May 24th}
Hi all, thanks so much for the feedback on this ticket and the Atlassian team appreciates your patience as we build out an improvement on this issue

Our research has shown that (1) significant portion of existing use cases for “date/time advanced settings” is to configure a date/time that makes sense for a specific location/country (2) cross geographic collaboration is a common and increasing use case that requires different date/time display between users within the same instance. To better adapt our product to this, we’ll progressively roll-out the following changes in upcoming days.
 * Users can now change the *default edit and display of both date and date/time fields*, *using their language/locale setup (i.e. "en_AUS" or "Dutch")* instead of being forced into the American month/day/year display only. Here’s how to setup yours: [https://support.atlassian.com/atlassian-account/docs/manage-your-language-preferences/]. For those using language not supported (i.e. Greek). We suggest you choose UK English as your preference to get the desired display of day/month/year.

 * As part of shifting such setting to the user level, in long term, we’ll remove the advanced admin setting of custom date/time format (which currently can be found under: System->User Interface->Look and feel->Date/time format). In the interim, warning message of “advanced date picker settings will no longer be supported” will appear.{panel}
h3.  
h3. Summary

When a custom date/time format has been configured and Jira is configured to use the new issue view, the custom date/time format is ignored and Jira displays the default date/time format.
h3. Environment
 * Jira Core

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a custom date/time format as shown [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-the-look-and-feel-of-your-jira-applications-780861527.html]
 # Navigate to an issue or select an issue from a board

h3. Expected Results
 * Custom date/time formats are displayed in the board/full issue views

h3. Actual Results
 * The default Jira date/time format is still displayed
 * Look and feel settings:

||Old view||New view||
|!Screen Shot 2019-01-03 at 01.25.19.png|thumbnail!|!Screen Shot 2019-01-03 at 01.26.06.png|thumbnail!|
h3. Notes
 * This issue doesn't occur in the old/existing issue view/board view
 * On Jira Core(Business) projects, there isn't an option to turn off the new issue view

h3. Workaround

There is no current workaround
fields.summary: New issue view: custom date/time format setting not respected in the new view

fields.description:
h3.Summary

When using HTTP request method OPTION for JIRA REST end points request, instead of returning 'Content-Type: application/json' it returns 'Content-Type: text/html' in the REST response which causes cross-origin read blocking (CORB) to certain REST clients.

h3.Investigation Done

{noformat}
soramaru@Soramaru-PC:~$ curl -D-  -u vchin@atlassian.com:<API_KEY>  -X OPTIONS -H "Content-Type: application/json"  https://zaansmeisje.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue/AT1-4                                                  

HTTP/1.1 204                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
Server: Atlassian Proxy/1.13.6.2                                                                                                                                                                                                             
Content-Type: text/html;charset=UTF-8                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=315360000; includeSubDomains; preload                                                                                                                                                                     
Date: Fri, 21 Dec 2018 14:10:22 GMT                                                                                                                                                                                                          
ATL-TraceId: f827cbf8ce11d20b                                                                                                                                                                                                                
X-AACCOUNTID: 557057%3Add697c0d-6cc7-429e-b8a1-4ccab4c19347                                                                                                                                                                                  
X-AREQUESTID: 8ed45740-71fd-46ca-850d-72449fe10da1                                                                                                                                                                                           
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block                                                                                                                                                                                                              
Timing-Allow-Origin: *                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
ATL-TCS-Time: 0                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
X-AUSERNAME: 557057%3Add697c0d-6cc7-429e-b8a1-4ccab4c19347                                                                                                                                                                                   
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff                                                                                                                                                                                                              
Connection: keep-alive                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
Set-Cookie: atlassian.xsrf.token=B9CT-DT45-MJ4N-MURT_ea9b5844075560a8901c2e657ad17d5d0621841b_lin; Path=/; Secure                                                                                                                            
Allow: OPTIONS,HEAD,DELETE,GET,PUT    
{noformat}

Notice that the 'Content-Type' is 'text/html' 

h3.Expected Behavior

When OPTIONS is used, content-type is returned as 'application/json'.

h3.Current Behavior 

When OPTIONS is used, content-type is returned as 'text/html'.

h3. Issue Summary

# Create a Sprint, assign issues and start the sprint

https://cl.ly/67e4fff20dbc

The issue should be transitioned and updated with the date

Change the interface language to English (US) and it will work.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Duplicate values are being returned for the find users API (/rest/api/3/user/search).
h3. Steps to reproduce the issue

Run GET to https://

{DomainURL}/rest/api/3/user/search?username=%&startAt=200&maxResults=200&includeInactive=true (copy results to a text editor (call 1))
Run a second GET to https://\{DomainURL}

/rest/api/3/user/search?username=%&startAt=400&maxResults=200&includeInactive=true (copy results to a text editor(call 2))
Compare the results by taking the last 2 users from call 1 and the first 2 users from call 2 and you should get a match
h3. Actual result

Call 1 retrieves users from 200 to 400. Call 2 retrieves users from 400 to 600. In theory, there should be 1 duplicate user (the last user from call 1 should be first in call 2) yet there are 2 duplicates.

The 2 last users from call 1 appear as the 2 first users in call 2.
h3. Expected result

Call 1 retrieves users from 200 to 400. Call 2 retrieves users from 400 to 600.. And there should be no duplicate.
h3. Workaround

Replacing maxResults to 99 from 200 seems to resolve the issue.
https://

{domainURL}/rest/api/2/user/search?username=%&startAt=100&maxResults=99&includeInactive=true&orderBy=+name
https://\{domainURL}

/rest/api/2/user/search?username=%&startAt=200&maxResults=99&includeInactive=true&orderBy=+name
https://

{domainURL}

/rest/api/2/user/search?username=%&startAt=300&maxResults=99&includeInactive=true&orderBy=+name
fields.summary: Duplicate values are being returned for the find users API (/rest/api/3/user/search).

fields.description:
h3. Current scenario

Currently, when a user uses the query below, only issues with a resolution defined:

{code}resolution not in (Done){code}

If the user wants to return issues with a resolution different from "Done" and the issues without a resolution, this user needs to use the query below:

{code}resolution not in (Done) or resolution is EMPTY{code}

h3. Impact

Although we understand that in an issue with the resolution "Unresolved" the resolution field value is empty, this current behavior can create some confusion when a user is searching for issues, what may create some frustration.

h3. Improvement

It would be better if when a user uses the query {{resolution not in (Done)}}, the issues without resolution could be returned also.
fields.summary: As a Jira user, I want the search to return issues without resolution when I use the clause "not in"

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to edit a time/date picker field via a mobile web browser, the keyboard on iOS cannot be minimized so that the entire calendar/time picker is visible.  The page scroll is locked - so it's not possible to scroll up/down to reveal the hidden portion(s) of the calendar/time picker.  Android users are able to minimize the keyboard and choose the desired date/time.

h3. Environment
* Jira
* iOS

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to any issue in a project that uses the "new issue view"
# Try to edit a date/time picker field

h3. Expected Results
* A calendar/time picker appears in full and the user is able to choose a time/date by tapping on a time/date option

h3. Actual Results
* The keyboard covers the calendar/time picker
* User is unable to minimize the keyboard so that the entire calendar/time picker is visible
 !Image 2018-12-19 at 16.32.01.jpeg|thumbnail! !Image 2018-12-19 at 16.32.01-2.jpeg|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
* Able to replicate issue on multiple iOS devices
* Confirmed that the issue occurs on iOS 11.4.1
* Issue occurs in Chrome and Safari
* Not sure if applicable, but during testing - we noticed that on iOS, the example date time field shows "Invalid Date", whereas on Android and OSX - the date/time field is displayed as expected
||iOS||Android||
| !Image 2018-12-27 at 11.58.29.jpeg|thumbnail!|  !Image 2018-12-27 at 12.04.01.jpeg|thumbnail! |
* Time picker is not scrollable on either Android or iOS - this will likely be another issue though
* Requesting the desktop version of Jira doesn't work on iOS
* Unable to scroll up/down to reveal the hidden portion of the calendar/time picker

h3.Workaround
* Use the Jira iOS mobile app(if appropriate)
fields.summary: iOS:  The date/time picker is hidden by the keyboard

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Some mail servers add single quotation mark around the email address. 
When the catch email address has quotation marks, Jira cannot process it.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Set a catch email address info@company.com
# Send a mail to 'info@company.com'

h3. Results
Jira doesn't process the message, and gave an error on incoming-mail-log:
"Cannot handle message as the recipient(s) do not match the catch email"

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve JIRA mail handler so it parses mail without single quotes around the mail address.
fields.summary: JIRA should handle incoming emails with single quote marks in Catch email address

fields.description:
* Description*
unable to create subtask when the Postfunction 'The field labels will take the value from Labels. Source issue is the parent, destination the sub-task.' is prioritised before the 'Creates the issue originally.' Post function

Does not allow to create a subtask.  

Error : We can't create this issue for you right now, it could be due to unsupported content you've entered into one or more of the issue fields. If this situation persists, contact your administrator as they'll be able to access more specific information in the log file.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

*Steps to reproduce the issue*
* Update Post function as in the below screenshot, on the Create issue transition.

!screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
* Make sure that the post function 'field labels will take the value from Labels. Source issue is the parent, destination the sub-task.' is of higher priority than the 'Creates the issue originally.' Post function
* Create a subtask.

You can see the issue.

* Troubleshooting*
* Observed that the issue is not reproducible when  'field labels will take the value from Labels. Source issue is the parent, destination the sub-task.' is of low priority than the 'Creates the issue originally.' Post function'
* ISsue is not reproducible for other custom fields like copy summary or priority

*Workaround*

Move the event of the post function after the "Creates the issue originally" and the field will be properly copied.

 !Transition__Create_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: unable to create subtask when the Postfunction 'The field labels will take the value from Labels. Source issue is the parent, destination the sub-task.' is prioritised before the 'Creates the issue originally.' Post function

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* As a Jira administrator when I try to import a Trello board to my Jira cloud site and if I have a Jira Software product enabled: [https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ExternalImport1.jspa]
*# I do not have the option to select to which project I want to import. 
*# I do not have the option to choose between a company-managed (formerly classic) project and a team-managed (formerly next-gen) project. 

h3. Suggested Solution
* Provide the option to the Jira administrator to choose the destination project and do not decide directly to import into a newly created team-managed (formerly next-gen) project as described currently in the documentation [Importing data from Trello|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-data-from-trello-951386555.html]. 


h3. Why this is important
* This way the Trello built in importer will be more powerful and efficient. 

 
h3. Workaround 
Currently, a valid workaround to import into a company-managed (formerly classic) project is to create a new test cloud site through [[https://www.atlassian.com/try]] with only Jira core product enabled and make the import in there. 
* Then, export the Jira issues into CSV to import them later in the destination project. 
* Or directly export to CSV from Trello if the Trello Business license if purchased.
fields.summary: As a Jira administrator I want to select a company-managed project as destination when using Trello import out of the box

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* When adding _post functions_ to a workflow transition, it is possible to choose the "*Clear field value*" function. 
* This function allows you select the *Status* field as the one to be cleared, which +should not be allowed+, as clearing this field causes the issue to *not be accessible*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create project > Edit the workflow > Add the post-function *"Clear field value"* to any transition
# Create an issue
# Run the transition to which the post function was added in *step 1*
# Try accessing the issue

h3. Expected Results
* Issue is accessible

h3. Actual Results
* Error saying *We couldn't connect to issue* is returned
 !Screen Shot 2018-12-21 at 12.39.32 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Proposed solution
* We recommend removing the field *Status* from the available options
fields.summary: "Clear field value" post-function should not include "Status" among choices

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Right now if you need to collect a date range information on a Jira ticket you must have two custom fields in place to get start date and end date.
 
h3. Suggested Solution
Jira should have a date picker custom field that allows the user to select a date range.
  
h3. Workaround 
Use two distinct date picker custom fields, one for start and other for end dates.
fields.summary: Date picker field for date range

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When editing an inactive workflow, Edge doesn't seem to respect the default "Screen" value of "None". So, when trying to add a transition - a 'blank' error message is displayed due to the "Screen" field not having a value.
h3. Environment
 * Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Jira settings > Issues > Workflows; Inactive
 # Click on a status, then click "Add transition"
 # Configure the new transition and try to add the new transition

h3. Expected Results
 * The transition is added without issue

h3. Actual Results
 * 'Blank' error message is displayed
 !Screen Shot 2018-12-20 at 16.57.17.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
 * This issue only seems to happen in Microsoft Edge, this is not on an issue on Chrome
 * For some reason, on Edge, the "Screen" field is empty and will cause a HTTP 400 response
 !Screen Shot 2018-12-20 at 16.44.39.png|thumbnail! 
(Screen = NaN)
 * Edge is not respecting the "Screen" field's default value of "None"
 * When performing the same action in Chrome, the "Screen" field value defaults to "None"
 !Screen Shot 2018-12-20 at 16.48.05.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
 * Ensure that the "Screen" field has a value before trying to add a transition
 * Click on a random transition within the workflow you'd like to edit instead of a status - then click "Add transition"
fields.summary: Microsoft Edge: 'Blank' error message when adding a transition to an inactive workflow

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In case you have next-gen projects and you have any Role in the People section of this project, you'll see in the Jira Project Role as you are not an Administrator of this project.
 !Screen Shot 2018-12-19 at 13.46.20.png|thumbnail! 

And, in case you have more next-gen projects and you don't have any Role in them, these projects is not listed in the Jira project roles at all.
 !Screen Shot 2018-12-19 at 13.47.36.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
h3. Scenario 1
# go to a next-gen project and add yourself as Admin of it.
# go to the https://<yourinstancename>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/roles/ViewUserProjectRoles.jspa page and you'll see you are not an Administrator of this project

h3. Scenario 2
# go to a next-gen project and remove yourself as Admin of it.
# go to the https://<yourinstancename>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/roles/ViewUserProjectRoles.jspa page and you won't see the specific project at all on the list
fields.summary: Jira project roles is inaccurate in User Management when you have next-gen projects created

!image-2018-12-20-15-46-40-802.png!

!image-2018-12-20-15-47-21-511.png!

Can this be added?
fields.summary: Using Notify button

fields.description:
I want to quickly assign labels to issues within the product backlog by selecting multiple and then clicking "Add Label" from the "..." context menu to better organize my product backlog.

Currently the listed actions for bulk edits are "Add flag" and "Add to Epic". I am suggesting "Add Label" be included.
fields.summary: Add "Add Label" action for bulk edit within product backlog (next-gen)

fields.description: When managing the product backlog I would like to multi-select issues to be dragged into a sprint without the issue sidebar opening and loading the newly clicked issue for each click.
fields.summary: Prevent issue from opening within backlog when selecting multiple (next-gen)

fields.description:
h3. Description
When adding fields as columns to be displayed for a filter, only 25 results are returned. In a situation where there are more than 25 results that match the string provided in the search, the desired result may not be returned.

h3. How to reproduce
 # Create multiple custom fields that contain the same word
 ** In the test performed, more than 25 custom fields had the word *Status* in their name
 # Open a filter in the *List view*
 # Click *Columns*
 # Search for the field you're looking to add

h3. Expected result
 * It would be expected that at least the field that matched *exactly* the string provided would be returned

h3. Actual result
 * Only 25 results are returned, but not necessarily the one you're expecting to see. Because there is no pagination, the desired result may not be reachable
  !Screen Shot 2018-12-20 at 6.54.35 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 * In the example above, there were more than 25 custom fields named *<something> Status*. The field to be added was the system field *Status*, but because of this behavior it was not possible to add it as a column, as it is not returned by the search.

h3. Workaround:
* Using [PUT - Add Filter Columns|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-api-3-filter-id-columns-put] endpoint, it is possible to set the columns of a filter you own. 

Below, an example of how this request can be executed using *cURL*. In this example, the updated filter would have the columns *Issue Key, Summary, Assignee and Status* set
{code}
curl -D- -u <emailAddress>:<apiToken> -X PUT -d columns=issuekey -d columns=summary -d columns=assignee -d columns=status https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/filter/{filterId}/columns
{code}
 * For custom fields, specify its IDs in the format *customfield_\{id\}* (i.e. customfield_10000)
fields.summary: When adding columns to filters, only 25 results are returned

h3. Notes
The next-gen project doesn't need to have any issues, it just needs to be there when the backup is generated, no other special configuration on the next-gen project is required.

h3. Workaround
In order for the import to succeed we can't have any next-gen project on the source Jira. One would need to create a new classic project and move the issues from the next-gen project to the classic project and then delete the next-gen project and generate a new backup. There are options to do so in the Backup Manager page for generating a backup for Jira Server, and we can use those and then generate a backup for Cloud.
* [Migrate between next\-gen and classic projects|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/migrate-from-an-agility-project-to-a-classic-project-957974933.html]
fields.summary: Jira import failing with generic PSQL Exception error

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a *Project admin* (not a *Jira admin*) goes to the "settings" section of the project, they can navigate to pages restricted to Jira admins only, causing a "request access" loop.

At this moment, this behaviour is happening in the following scenarios:

# When a Project admin navigates to the newly added "Issue layout" section, the name of the screen has a hyperlink to edit that screen;
# When a Project admin navigates to the "Fields" section, they can click on the number of the screens used by that field and, again, the name of the screen has a hyperlink to edit that screen.

Video:
 [^JRACLOUD-71262.mp4] 

For more in-depth details of the distinction of a Project admin vs a Jira admin, please refer to our [Permissions Oversview|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/permissions-overview-764478244.html] documentation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Log in as an user who is administrator of a specific project, but isn't a Jira admin;
* Select the relevant project, then click *settings*;
* Click *Issue layout* (for example).

h3. Expected Results
* The name of the screen is only mentioned in the section.

h3. Actual Results
* The name of the screen actually contain a hyperlink to edit that screen. Since editing a screen is an operation restricted to Jira admins only, the project admin will end up in a "request access" loop.

h3. Workaround(s)
* At this moment, there is none.
fields.summary: Edit screen operation is available to Project admin (not Jira admin), causing a "request access" loop

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When accessing the search issues page and the create issue screen, there two buttons called "Import Issues from CSV" and "Import issues" buttons, but those are not working.

h3.Steps to reproduce

* From issues and filters page:
# Go to issues and filters;
# Then Search Issues;
# Select "Import Issues from CSV" from the drop-down.
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-08 at 15.12.03.png|thumbnail! 

* From create issue screen:
# Click on the plus sign "+";
# Click on "Import issues";
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-08 at 15.13.02.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected results

The CSV should import with no issues.

h3. Actual result

This path does not work for CSV import.

h3. Workaround

The correct navigation is:
* Jira Settings > System > External System Import > Select CSV.
fields.summary: "Import Issues from CSV" button not working

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change your language setting to "日本語 (日本)" (Japanese)
# In a dashboard, add "アクティビティ ストリーム"(Activity Stream)
# Click "グローバルフィルターを追加します。"(add global filter)
# Select "更新日"(Updated date), "一致"(matches)
# Select a date from the calendar

h3. Expected Results
No errors are shown

h3. Actual Results
An error is shown saying the date format is invalid.
 !スクリーンショット 2018-12-20 12.09.46.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
* Copying the date from the English setting(e.g. Dec/20/2018) to the Japanese setting page won't solve this issue. There are no way discovered to set the Updated date if the user is using Japanese setting

h3.Workaround
Change the language setting to English and don't open the edit dialog when using Japanese. If you do so, it is unable to save the settings again and the Updated date set will be erased. You will have to change the language setting to English again.
fields.summary: Unable to set the updated date for global filter in Activity Stream gadget using Japanese

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using the *[changed|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-operators-reference-764478341.html]* operator against a user without specifying a *predicate* on a webhook will trigger a 500 error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to webhook page configuration on your cloud site [<your_site>.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/webhooks#]
# Insert a JQL query that includes the *change* operator with a user related field (such as assignee, reporter etc)
#*  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
#* Ensure to not specify a *predicate* 
# Try to save the newly created webhook. 

h3. Expected Results
A new webhook is created and it will get triggered when the JQL query is verified. 

h3. Actual Results

* A 500 error *java.lang.NullPointerException* is thrown in the logs. 
* The following error shows up in the UI? 
**  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!  
* The webhook page is broken
* The webhook page won't load anymore. 
* The other existent webhooks won't show anymore. 

h3.Workaround
* Currently, there is no workaround, you cannot use the *change* operator in a JQL query inside a webhook configuration.
fields.summary: Webhook page throw 500 error when using "changed" operator without specifying a predicate

fields.description:
h3. Description
 * Field configurations are not reflecting some changes applied to certain fields' renderers. This problem applies to updating renderers used by fields such as *Component/s*, *Affects Version/s* and *Fix Version/s*.

h3. Additional details
 * Although it is not confirmed whether this is directly related to the cause, all of these fields have the same options available: *Autocomplete* and *Select List*

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Access a Field Configuration
 # Click *Renderer* to update a field's renderer (This is applicable to *Component/s*, *Affects Version/s* and *Fix Version/s*)
 # Change the renderer
 !Screen Shot 2018-12-19 at 3.39.51 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 # Confirm update
 !Screen Shot 2018-12-19 at 3.40.20 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected result
 * Renderer is updated

h3. Actual result
 * Renderer is still displayed as the original one, although the value is changed in the database
 !Screen Shot 2018-12-19 at 4.17.24 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Changes made to field renderers are not reflected in Field Configuration

fields.description: Implement the ability to view and edit custom fields of type "Select List (cascading)".

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On the personal settings page https://example.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa if the language is not set the user can´t change any settings and there is no specific error message.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to personal settings - https://example.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa
# Check if in the field language the option *Pick your language* is selected
 !Screen Shot 2018-12-19 at 11.30.28.png|thumbnail! 
# Try to change any other settings and click *Save changes*

h3. Expected Results
An error message informing that the language is required must be displayed to force the user to choose a language

h3. Actual Results
The generic error message below is displayed:
{code:java} "couldn't save your preferences something went wrong. try again. reload this page." {code}

h3. Workaround
Ensure that the language is set before saving any changes
fields.summary: Trying to change personal settings when language is not set is throwing generic error message

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When impersonating a user, on the quick search Jira is respecting the permissions of the user that is impersonating (*Site-admin*) and not the permissions of the user that is being impersonated.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new permission scheme granting *Browse Project* permission only to the group *Administrators*.
# Have two users, *User A* as a member of the *Administrators* group and as a *site-admin* and *User B* as a regular user
# On a test project apply the new permission scheme created on step 1
# Login as the *User A* and impersonate the *User B* 

h3. Expected Results
The quick search should respect the permissions of the user that is being impersonated *User B* and not display issues from the test project

h3. Actual Results
When impersonating the *User B* the quick search is not respecting the permissions of the impersonating user, instead, it is respecting the permissions of the *User A* (site-admin)
 
h3. Notes
This is not happening on the search page, only in the quick search on Jira's sidebar. 

This leads the site-admin to believe that the impersonated user can search for the tickets but in fact, they can't.

h3.Workaround
No workaround so far
fields.summary: When impersonating a user the quick search is not respecting the impersonated user permissions

fields.description:
Currently, Jira's new issue view does not allow users to vote for issues.

This is possible only in the old issue view. 

The workaround is to switch to the old issue view by clicking on the avatar at the bottom-left corner → *Personal Settings* and flip the switch in the *Jira Labs* section.
fields.summary: Users can't vote in the new issue view

https://\{domain}.atlassian.net/projects/\{project}/versions/\{versionId}/tab/release-report-all-issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence customers are experiencing an issue in the Jira Issue Macro where the Username in a JQL Filter is being converted to it's Atlassian account ID. 
This causes the Jira Issue Macro to fail to load if they use a "WAS IN" condition; example: 
{code} assignee was in (some.user) {code}
turns into 
{code}assignee was in (<RANDOM USER ID>) {code}

Running this 'AaID' filter in Jira directly does not load results either

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Run a "WAS IN" JQL search against a User's Atlassian account ID

h3. Expected Results
Results are returned. 

h3. Actual Results
The value '<RANDOM USER ID>' does not exist for the field 'assignee'.
 
h3. Notes
A JQL query of {code}assignee in (<RANDOM USER ID>) {code} works however it can be a different result set depending on other conditions of the JQL (date, etc)

h3.Workaround
Usernames still work in Jira, but this may affect Saved Filters if those Usernames are converted to their AaIDs
fields.summary: Unable to JQL Search Using Atlassian account ID

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The links to user profiles in the audit log are broken.

In the audit log, if you hover over any user, the message *User does not exist* is displayed. If you click the user to go to his profile, the message *The specified user could not be found* is displayed. 

h3. Environment


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# go to the Audit log (press g+g, type audit log and press enter)
# search for any user and hover over his name/click the user name

h3. Expected Results
* hovering over the user name should display the user avatar and some profile information
* clicking the user name should lead to the user profile page

h3. Actual Results
* hovering over the user name shows the message *User does not exist*
* clicking the user name shows the message *The specified user could not be found*

h3. Notes


h3. Workaround
fields.summary: User does not exist message in Audit Log

We don't see any issue with English. The Problem is specific to Jira console in German

This can be replicated internally

None

Certain Russian characters appears differently when it's surrounded by curly brackets "{{ }}" AND underscores "_ _" in issue's description or comment.

* Jira Cloud

* Chrome browser

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Surround following text with (double) curly brackets AND underscores in description or comment field
{code}
Выделенный текст
{code}
 !Description - Edit mode.png|thumbnail! 
# Save the description/comment
 !Description - Saved.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
Sometimes a company buys another company and they both use Jira Cloud. Part of the corporate integration includes *merging* the 2 Jira cloud sites. 

Please provide a functionality that would ease this operation. 

Ideally, everything from one site should be migrated to the other in a matter of a few clicks and checks.
fields.summary: provide a functionality for merging 2 Jira Cloud sites

fields.description:

# In an instance which has the new issue view enabled for the full-issue view, navigate to Issues and Filter -> All issues
# In the search result, select list from the menu in the top-right
# Click one of the issue summary which points to an issue

The issue detail view will open in the new issue view

As far I see I am not able to change the status of an issue in the Edit-Issue screen.

That makes integrations like the realtimeboard one a bit useless (beside a strange usability in general) because I can't change the status in realtimeboard but instead I have to switch to Jira and then back to realtimeboard (or any other connected service).
